intro: Pilosella collina subsp. elegans, commonly known as the elegant mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and small, yellow flower heads that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its delicate appearance and habitat preferences, it is often found in mountainous areas with cool, moist conditions.
